documents.document: @LittleMissAoife @Raqidoodle @EmmyMaher @SexSiopa lol! TBH I've got one unsolicited dick pic in my life. I now just get a lot of "hey gorgeous" bots. So I keep asking them to sign up to my Patreon. No luck yet.
@JohnVid60734083 John! Hi! Great to hear from you. Would you consider becoming a patron? https://t.co/3brCZoyiRX
*er, it will be fun. We're having a real-life meet-up! TBC. End of September. You could be in it! Come to the book club! The end xoxo And link again cos why not: https://t.co/EgzS2soUrt

It also helps make me feel like the work I do has value - and patrons get extra perks, including Patreon-only content (one of my money diaries per month from now on is going to be Patreon-only), minisodes of my podcast, access to a FUN* book club AND MORE.

Do you follow me on social media (er, probably, if you're reading this)? Could you spare $1 a month to support my work? I have a Patreon set up that essentially asks people who follow - and enjoy following - me to contribute to the cost of that work. https://t.co/EgzS2soUrt

@sinead_ryan No because she asked about adding her parents and he said explicitly that "only a partner" would reduce it!
@sinead_ryan Well, er, I have 3 points to be fair 😂
@sinead_ryan But she added me, a "friend", and it cost her an extra €10. She asked whether adding a parent would reduce it and was told no, it had to be a partner
@neasaconneally She asked if adding a parent would reduce it and was told no, only a partner.
@JulieDil Yep!
Context: she had her partner on her premium last year, removing him now as they've since split, but she was told that keeping him on would reduce her total. Adding a friend (me) cost her €10 extra.

A friend of mine just got a quote for her car insurance and, on the phone, was told that adding a partner to her insurance would reduce the premium. She's single. What is the logic here and isn't that discriminatory against the incels of the world?

Full disclosure: I'm working on a project with Odeon Cinemas between now and December, but tweeting about what I would wear to a screening of Clueless is not part of our partnership. JUST TO BE CLEAR.

@AoifeSpud @EvistonAoife @ainecarroll127 @Aoife_Dooley @pvssykat @mermaidajade @whitemoosecafe @JohnMooneyST The problem is, the concept of BU was never a bad one. But it's all been sullied by the very strong evidence that BU is this renowned troll. Exposing influencers for lying to / misleading followers is good. But if it's done by a troll who's obsessed with bloggers it becomes dirty
